title.narrative: PESRTD land inventory in Burkina Faso 2017-2021

description.narrative: Jorderosionen minskar Burkina Fasos jordbrukspotential och landets regering ämnar utarbeta en strategi och en arbetsplan för att vända den negativa trenden. Som underlag för dessa krävs en inventering av marktillståndet i landet. Insatsen syftar till att finansiera denna inventering inkl förslag på handlingsprogram. Arbetet samordnas av miljöministeriet och i det deltar även jordbruksministeriet och andra myndigheter. Insatsen har en budget om 500 000 kr för fas 1 men genom avtalstillägg nr 3 ökades denna till 1 573 000 kr samtidigt som aktivitetsperioden förlängdes till 20211031 och avtalets giltighet till 20220522.

Soil erosion is reducing the agricultural potential in Burkina faso and the country's government will therefore formulate a strategy and a work plan for reversing the negative trend. As a basis for these, a national inventory of the soil condition is necessary. The contribution aims at funding such an inventory and the formulation of a draft work plan. This work will be coordinated by the Ministry of Environment and carried out in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture and other governemental actors. The contribution had initially a budget of 500 000 SEK but it was increased to 1 573 000 kr with the agreement amendment no 3 and the activity period extended to 20211031 as well as the agreement's validity to 20220531.

tag.narrative: 15.3 - By 2030, combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world.

15.3 - Till 2030 bekämpa ökenspridning, återställa förstörd mark och jord, inklusive mark som drabbats av ökenspridning, torka och översvämningar, samt sträva efter att uppnå en värld utan nettoförstöring av mark.

title.narrative: 11281 PESRTD-NDT decision on agreement amendment no 3 20210317

description.narrative: This report was long overdue due to delays in the implementation of the project. According to the project implementor, SP-CPSA, these delays are due to defaulted payments by the Government of Burkina Faso and by the GIZ. In view of the small size of the financial contribution by the Embassy (500 000 SEK), the results are assessed as satisfying. It should be stressed that the study (inventory) of the state of soils & vegetation and the identification of causes of the degradation are of a high strategic importance to Burkina Faso. Further, in the requested extension period a strategic work is planned in the form of formulation and validation of a national as well as 13 regional actions plan with the aim of achieving land degradation neutrality – all to be integrated into the national development program for the rural sectors, PNSR3. The definition of land degradation neutrality is formulated as follows by the UN Convention on Desertification: “A state whereby the amount and quality of land resources, necessary to support ecosystem functions and services and enhance food security, remains stable or increases within specified temporal and spatial scales and ecosystems”. After the start-up period in 2017, funded by the World Bank, the project has achieved the following main results on funding by Sweden : - Extensive generation of information on land use, land productivity, land degradation and soil carbon storage in the country’s 13 regions, divided into four geographical clusters - A report that summarizes the information above for the whole country - Detailed reports for each of the 13 regions with the same information plus proposed targets and measures to achieve land degradation neutrality. An extension of the agreement with increased budget has been requested in order to prepare actions plans for each of the 13 regions and for the country as a whole but also for integrating the actions plans into the national development plan PNSR3 (Programme National du Secteur Rural).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
